lines.text: UPf 10/23 1C46 us-smokelesshoider

not be republished or redistributed, in whole or in part, without the prior

(UPI Focus)
Philip Morris tests smokeless holcier
NEW YORK, Oct. 23 (UPI) - Philip Mrris Companies is pianning to test a
cigarette.
The New York Times reports that the battery-powered *smoking systern" is
the first of Its kind and cost $200 million to develop after years of
research.
The Times says the beeper-sized, four-ounce box tentatively called the
"Accord" contains an electronically controliled lighter that runs on
rechargeable batteries.
The tobacco burns only when puffed, which means smokers could take a
puff from a cigarette in its holder, put it down and inhale again an hour
later.
The device would, in theory, eliminate 90 percent of second-hand smoke,
but smokers would still inhale the same 3 milligrams of tar and . 2
milligrams of nicotine that is in so-called "ultralight" cigarettes.
Critics say the device demonstrates the lengths the tobacco industry
will go to make a dangerous addiction more socialy acceptable.
The device wil be made avallable over the next month to smokers in
controiled tests in the U.S. and Japan. It will not be made commercially
available in test markets for at least a year.
Copyright 1997 by United Press International.
All rights reserved.
